snippet: Officials said at least 58 people were known to have died in the past few days, but the death toll was expected to rise substantially.
abstract: Heavy rainfall stifles efforts to rescue villagers buried by series of landslides in Sri Lanka, which have killed at least 58 people; death toll is expected to rise.

byline.original: By DHARISHA BASTIANS and GEETA ANAND
byline.contributor: Dharisha Bastians reported from Aranayake, and Geeta Anand from Mumbai, India.

lead_paragraph: Officials said at least 58 people were known to have died in the past few days, but the death toll was expected to rise substantially.

headline.main: Hope in Sri Lanka Dwindles, Unlike Rain, Amid Landslide Rescue Efforts
headline.print_headline: Hope in Sri Lanka Dwindles Amid Landslide Rescue Effort
